It's a strange sensation: the mixing of the hot veggies and meat, the cold yogurt, the crispy wonton shells - all of it crunched up in a bowl. 

Hasan, the owner and one of the friendliest faces in all of Philadelphia, explained every step of how he prepares and serves the food. Then, for dessert, he prepared a carrot and cream cheese dish, with hot, stewed carrots (naturally sweet) and homemade cheese. It was somehow similar to a pumpkin or sweet potato pastry. 

Like other reviewers's experience, I too was blown away by both Hasan's kindness and his restaurant. He remembers faces well, and will prepare you a different kind of dish every time you visit. He promised a different, hot rice and beans dish next time I came. He also assured my girlfriend and I that we would not have to pay if we didn't like the food. However, we loved the chaat and the dessert, and were more than happy to pay every cent (though he didn't charge us for the dessert). Can't wait to go back!

Visited Mood's cafe for the first time yesterday , the awesome food was matched by Hasan's warmth as a host . The food is absolutely splendid. I had the paneer chaat with an apple fig lassi . The chaat was really good but the lassi was exceptional , this has got to be the closest I have had to the real thing ( try the salt lassi if you have the taste for it , exceptional !!) . Also the owner Hassan is a great host , taking interest in a customer and treating them like a human being there to enjoy food as opposed to just a number to serve a dish too is all the difference between a great place and just another restaurant and the experience I had here was awesome !! I will be back for more chaat and lassi

Rarely write a review but gotta do this one. the food with the price is completely perfect. 

Lassi taste super natural, feeling like you're eating real fruit. chaat is perfect for a small dinner. taste delicious

the seat at the corner was quite and beautiful for hanging out, reading, chatting.

owner was super friendly and gave me rice budding as a treat as he knows I'm leaving town.

Definitely remcommend this place and definitely come back to Philly just for this.

Best Chaat hands down! This was my first time ever having it with my husband and it was the most flavorful meal I had in Philadelphia! It was perfectly spiced and extremely tasty. The owner, Hassan, is super nice and friendly and very accommodating! I def recommend you come here if you want a fantastic, spicy, tasty, flavorful meal. The owner even made us a mango lassi that went perfectly with our Chaat bowl. Thanks Hassan! We ll be back for sure!
Tiny little place with some Indian chaat and smoothie options , staff is not friendly and too small to accommodate a big group!

Awesome! I went last night having never had chaat before, and Hasan (the owner) was so great! He asked me what I liked and made the perfect dish just for me. The dish was colorful, crunchy, creamy, meaty, savory, sweet and sour all at the same time, and it works together in a way I never imagined food could. The lassi was great as well (mango and honey), and Hasan let me try a rice pudding that was so so good, not thin like most puddings I've tried before but creamy with a subtle spice. I will definitely be a regular from now on!

Amazing little place! They have so many unique flavors of lassi (yogurt drink) and chaat!!! They had a chicken Tikka Chaat which was amazing! And the lassi was really really good too! The price was also very reasonable. Can't wait to go again when I visit Philly!

Very unpleasant, disinterested and unhelpful service -  a hostility unlike anything I have ever experienced in a restaurant so highly rated by Yelp.  I asked if they had saag chat, and the man behind the counter looked at me like I was speaking Chinese.  "Spinach chat?" I translated.  It was all he could do to wave at the menu board, which in no way explained what each dish had.  When we paid, it took him several minutes to be able to change the $20 bill for our order.  Once the owner arrived (after we had ordered), this same man suddenly became friendly.  STAY AWAY -- there is a lot more friendly food just down the street at Aksum.  They don't hate the customer!!
Sub Par Service I ordered a beef dish and it was like deep fried meatloaf. I didn't enjoy it at all. The naan was good tho.

First I was little skeptic when I saw the shop. Once I went in there, it was super clean and the food was AMAZING. He is nice and caters to your needs (spicy, sweet...). I highly recommend a visit. You will be surprised.

Nothing I can add here that hasn't already been said. The friendly owner will guide you through the menu like a champ and introduce you to the wonderful world of lassi and chaat. A delicious, flavorful, fresh meal to go. Choose the lamb - it's heavenly.

mmmm, this will likely be an unpopular opinion, but i thought the chaat was okay. it wasn't amazing or addicting like i was anticipating it to be. it is a yummy mix though! the owner is super passionate and seems very kind, which i really admire. also - best mango lassi i've ever had!
Such an amazing mix of awesome flavors. And the owner is the nicest shop keeper ever. Guided us through the menu and made great suggestions. Well definitely return!
Awesome!!! Literally every bite is a new sensation in your mouth. I came once, by yelp suggestion. I came back and bought my family because the taste was indescribably good!!

Amazing food. Don't be intimidated by the foreign names, the food is delicious. The owner is super friendly and is enthusiastic about discussing what goes into his food. The ingredients are the freshest and some of the best quality "street" food. It's so easy to grab and go at this place.

Great food, great service, great all around! When we arrived they were in the middle of closing up for the night, but Hasan graciously stayed open a bit longer so we could put our orders in. Since I was overwhelmed with the selection, Hasan put together a delicious beginners meal. The rose lassi was A+, and the veggie samosa chaat was so so good. I will definitely make the trip back!

Super friendly service. Amazingly diverse set of menu options. Grab a smoothie of your choice and a halal salad.  All the smoothies and salads can be made vegan or non-vegan and they have regular meat options like chicken and beef. A great spot.

If wish I had an option to give more than 5 stars!! Best ever chaat and lassi!! The owner is a gem of a person and will talk you through the best combinations of food and will make your experience an unforgettable event. We were given extra lassi and sweets over and above what we ordered. I would love to come here again and again. I wish him all the success and more mint-lassi stories like the one he told us ;-)

A very unique, yummy meal! Check out my full review with pictures below! :)
http://goodyummyeats.wordpress.com/2013/08/18/mood-cafe-ecstasy-guaranteed/

Even though I don't live anywhere near Mood Cafe, I regularly travel across the city for their chaat and lassis. The owner is sweet, funny and generous--I have seen him send an indecisive pregnant woman home with an extra chaat on the house, just in case she second-guessed her choice of flavor, and today when I asked him to explain a certain seasoning to me, he gave me a free second drink so that I could sample it. The food is always wildly flavorful and so, so satisfying, whether as a summer picnic meal or a light, spicy way to warm up in wintertime.

If you have any questions or want a recommendation as to what to order, be sure to ask the owner! Hearing his explanations and having him customize your chaat and lassi is an important part of the Mood Cafe experience.

hassan now has dosa, an indian favorite similar to a crepe that is made of lentils and then stuffed with delicious things! such a great addition for the chilly weather as they are served piping hot and fresh...

i think that hassan may be the only one making these in the philadelphia area so it's worth the trip. hassan the owner is one of the kindest people i know!
Am still not sure what I ate here (chaat) but boy it was an explosion of all five senses. The Chaats are an explosion of flavors! Also try the lassis, can't go wrong!

Ask the owner for suggestions! He's amazing. I had never had chaat before so he talked me through all the options and eventually just had him give me the most simple item- samosa chaat. 

Be sure to emphasize that vegan because yogurt sauce is a default ingredient.
The lassis are okay but the chaats could be a lot fresher, i.e., made using fresh ingredients that weren't sitting out all day! An okay place to grab a snack but nothing to get too excited about.

I can't thank the other reviewers enough for the tip--nor Hassan and Daniel for the welcome. A dinner at Mood was the end to an almost magical evening; I have never been so warmly welcomed or felt at home in a food establishment before. New to chaat and lassies, Hassan took out time just before he went on his break to teach us all about how to select a combination we'd like--and within my dietary restrictions. They were incredibly encouraging and so thoughtful--assuring us multiple times that if we didn't like it they'd find something we would enjoy. It was extremely reassuring as the choices were a bit overwhelming for two excited newbies looking to explore.

As other customers came in Daniel continued to share samples of their lassis--including new ones he made to experiment-- from beet/lemon/ginger to guava to strawberry/coconut/peanut butter. My boyfriend had the Mango (luscious, creamy); I was overjoyed with the insanely clean and sweet coconut. Both tasted incredibly fresh--though mine was more icy than smooth (perfect for the next day after a night in the freezer).

As for the chaat...it was wonderful! As everyone has noted it's nearly impossible to describe. I have many dietary restrictions (spicy, lactose, fried foods being among them) and was nervous, so chose the paneer. It was very different that I've had in other preparations, but delicious scrambled in combination with the beautifully sweet/salty/savory combinations of mint/raspberry/spicy sauces and I'm not even sure what else. My boyfriend--asking for the most authentic/spicy preparation-- had the chicken tikki (a bit too much sauce, but wonderfully hot).

Mood Cafe is a gem-- we stayed for over 2 hours chatting with Daniel and other regulars. We've never had such an incredible experience and the passion both Hassan and Daniel felt for the business and food was contagious. I hope to run my own business with that joy someday.
My first Chaat and Lassi. May others love up to it in the future. Chicken salad chaat and a honey and fig lassi. Delicious!!!

Love this place! Have been here around 5 times in the past year, and its always good! Sometimes I also come just to get the Lassi!

I always get the chicken chaat and I am never disappointed. When I first came, it was definitely something I wasn't sure if I would like bc it was my first time having anything like this. There are so many different ingredients and spices here but somehow it all works together. 

I usually get the Mango Lassi, which is always on point. But got the Lychee lassi last time and it was just as good. Im trying to try all the flavors one by one. 

Always a great place to go for a good meal. Only bad thing about this place is that this place is very small and has barely enough seats for 5 people. There are few places to sit outside as well, but not much.

This place is insanely blowing my mind. I went with my husband and a friend of ours on my birthday...right after we walked in, the owner of the Mood Cafe welcomed us with his big smile and passionate explanation on what Mood Cafe is famous for! He emphasized so many times that if we dont like the food or even just think the food is so so...he will not charg us!! Geeezzz...he is a Buddha in real world ;) then he told us to just choose the meat, and he will make his highly recommended chatt for us. Also...the lassi is insanely fresh! We ordered mango the classic, almond pistachio, and leechi...all A+ style. The place is more like take out restaurant, but you also can sit and eat there. In the end, the onwer even offered us the Carrots Dessert...i fogort the name of that dessert..but it is awesome. My whole experience there was fabulous and he made our day! He is a guy who truly loves his food and wants people to enjoy his food as much as he does.. Please go there and try the food...you will NOT regret! We will definitely go back again!!!
Had my first lassi here and it was great!!!  Will definitely be returning to try all of the other flavors (had the mango one but want to try the fig one next!)  Overall A+++!!!!!

PROS:

* Nicest owner to have ever existed

* Best chaat in Philly, hands down

* Damn good lassis


CONS:

* It was, like, 10 blocks away from where I lived.

Attention adresse incontournable !
Dans la banlieue de Philly, le mood café ne paye pas de mine extérieurement. Cependant l'endroit est propre avec deux-trois table à l'intérieur et quelques unes dehors.

Le patron/cuistot/unique employé le jour de notre venue était disponible et prévenant sans être étouffant. Il a pris le temps de nous expliquer le chaat (street food indienne) et de nous donner des conseils.

Une cuisine savoureuse avec plus d'une dizaine de saveurs. Accompagné d'un lassi.
Le dessert nous a été offert (une sorte de fromage de chèvre un peu fermenté dans une crème - mélange sucré et salé déroutant mais bon).

Deux chaat et un lassi pour 25$. Une découverte culinaire et un très bon moment.

Si nous revenons à Philly, nous retournerons dans cet endroit.

Not that this place needs another 5 star review, but I have to say, the best value for the food I have ever gotten as far as I can remember. And the service you just can't put a price on. Hassan (I hope I am spelling his name right) was over the top. He took the time to explain the different menu options and finally made me something that was awesome. This joint takes "Chaat" to a whole different level compare to what I am custom to in DC Metro. Definitely will stop by again if I am around Philly area.
Amazing customer service. I've been there numerous times. Lassis and chaats are good! I especially like rose lassi...

I was saving Mood Cafe for my 200th review because I went here a few weeks ago and I just loved the Crazy Chaat!  

Crazy chaat is similar to other chaat, with fresh ingredients, but it has lots of different flavoured crispy bits -- so much fun!  I can't attest to its authenticity -- I have no idea about that, since I've only ever had chaat at 2 places in Philly -- but I can attest to its deliciousness.  The crisps in the chaat are the perfect textures, popping and crunching, while flavours mix and meld in the different sauces and toppings.  I don't know how to describe it all -- it's too crazy!  Top marks in taste and texture.

Cardamom lassi is also refreshing and yummy.

The owner, Hasan, is very friendly & helpful, and happy to explain if you have any questions.  Looking forward to going back.

My first stop on the way to Philly...actually it might be the reason we go to Philly!  Love the authentic chaat.  And the Lassi's are exceptional- a variety of flavors that entice the tastebuds.  Pistachio/almond is a fave, but the menu offers so much more.  The owner and his assistant always smile and chat (pun intended).  Space is limited here to a few seats, but a nice walk with a lassi- perfection!  The only negative is...wait, there isn't one!

Oh my God what a disappointment!! I feel really bad that I convinced my friends to try out this place. The owner markets having chicken tikka, Indian chat and lassi (smoothies). If you know real indian food do not go expecting good indian tikka or chat. Basically they threw everything into one dish. Chat ingredients, chicken tikka and even fruit. It literally felt like someone collected all the leftovers in one plate and served you. Never going there again. Maybe if he markets it as something different, I would say okay to each his own. But when you say you have something on your menu, I expect that and I expect it made well.

So my friend says, "Hey you like Indian Food?" 
I say, "I've never had it before."
My friend punches me in the face for being uncultured and I wake up at Mood Cafe. 

Honestly, if I wasn't there with friends, I would've walked out. It was clean and nice, but seeing a bunch Chex Mix and random things in canisters behind the counter...I had my doubts about the food. Then I saw someone's order and really thought my friend had developed a drug habit. 

Then she told me to just talk to Hassan (the owner?), who apparently is the most popular person on Yelp. He explained right off the bat that a chaat is random as hell. The ingredients don't really sound like they go well together and when you see it, it will look very strange. But he promised I'd like it or give me my money back. With that kind of guarantee, I could see why people like him. Since it was his dime, I went ahead and got a lassie too. 

The chicken chaat, although it didn't look very appealing, was pretty good. I can't tell you for the life of me what it tasted it like. It was sweet, salty, savory, spicy, mild, cold, lukewarm, creamy and crunchy all at the same time...just like Hassan said. Every bite tasted different than the preceding. The mixed berry lassie is basically a yogurt based smoothie and it worked well to quell the heat from the chaat. Not only did I finish everything, I gave him a tip.

I ordered samosa chaat and mint+honey lassi. This was one of the best chaats I have ever had and lassi was so refreshing, he nailed it!!

I must say I didn't find lassi, made so yumm, even in India. 

A must try for everyone.
The sweetest owner that knows how to introduce a new, flavorful dish that is sure to please anybody!

I was so hungry and decided to search Yelp one day. Came across this cafe not too far from me by surprise and I was delighted. My first time trying chaat and it was amazing. I ordered the crazy chicken chaat salad. I'll be back again, again, and again.
Such a nice place with nice staff. We went in very unknowledgable about lassi and the man recommended the mango and then gave us extra. Will be back soon
One of the best places to get inexpensive and delicious food in West Philly. The flavors are just unbelievable at times. Keep doing your thing, Mood Cafe!

The guy that owns this place is really helpful & wants his customers to enjoy good food. I'd go there more often but samosas are just a once in a while treat for me, not a weekly go- to or staple. Too bad, this stuff's pretty good!

Tried a lassi for the first time and it was pretty tasty. I had the mango and my friend had the fig and apple, I'd recommend both. The person that served us was super friendly and insisted we tasted his creations before we left to make sure we liked them, super friendly right? I'm A fan.

I meant to do a review on Mood Cafe months ago!  I was introduced to Mood Cafe by my friend, who said that it was a phenomenal experience.  Hassan is extremely friendly towards newcomers and is always ready to give suggestions about new lassi combinations.  Whenever I go there, I always ask for a custom lassi and sometimes indulge in some tasty chaat.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone!

The place is amazing, try everything on the lassi menu - if you live here and can come here again. Hasan was a splendid host and he made a special rose lassi (should be the best selling one in this area). Must visit cafe! He was caring enough to make sure we left home safe at late night - almost close to 10 PM. I will come back again when I'm in this area... thanks Mr.Haasan.. keep going and help the people with crazy tasting food..!
Deliciously refreshing lassies. So many flavors popping in your mouth. A surprise in every bite. Heaven in West Philly.

This place is beyond phenomenal and what an awesome taste it has !!! 

I went there by luck in search of some nice shakes (lasi) and was blown away from the variety they have there. The owner himself is a great guy and very hospitable. Even though the prices are little bit high but the quality and the great taste u get is absolutely worth it. I travel to PA just for having the chats and lasi from this place.

I love this place! I'm usually not a fan of fruit smoothies, but the lassi's at Mood Cafe are great. I have tried some samples of flavors such as pineapple and melon which were very good but the mango remains my favorite. The owner is extremely welcoming and helpful and offers to make a new lassi if you are not satisfied with the one made.  Exceptional service and delicious lassi's.

Mood Cafe's the place where I take all my friends - I can't believe some people still haven't heard of Hassan and his life's work to share his food with all of humanity. He waits on every customer, teaching us how to appreciate his creation and customizes the offerings on his menu to our tastes. Money isn't a priority for him; he declares that we aren't allowed to pay for our food until we've tasted it and agree that it is better than any other chaat and lassi we've ever had. And in the past he's refused my tips, given me dessert on the house, and generously treated my friends and me with his time and his life stories. He's shared with me his dream of opening a real restaurant, equipped with stoves and ovens, so that he could really share with us what he makes at home for his family. What a man. You definitely won't regret coming here.

Wow!  Great service and delicious food.  There is something magical about how the many of flavors mix together into delightful experience.  Crunchy smooth sweet salty tangy.  That is how he explained "Chaat".  And how is it possible to have so many Lassi flavors?  Glad I made the trip from up North.

I've heard from people who know chaat that the "chaat" at Mood Cafe is not authentic at all.  The food is still good, though, so my advice for reducing cognitive dissonance in experienced chaat-eaters is to come here, eat the food & ignore the fact that they're calling it "chaat".

The chaat here is full of crispy bits, as well as bits of fresh vegetables (radish, onion), nuts, and sauces or chutneys. In addition to the Crazy Chaat I've had before, I also quite like the Punjabi Chaat -- it has the crispy bits and sweetness I like. Samosa chaat was fine; the samosa was warm, soft and comforting, pretty standard.  Shahi chaat has lots of nuts, but the combination of textures didn't suit me.

Lassis are good here. I've had rose and cardamom lassis & they were both good.

Mood Cafe has great vegetarian options that are good, healthy, and fresh. I highly recommend them!  Be aware that there isn't much seating inside.

this might've been one of the few times my trusted fellow yelpers have let me down:

it was raining (pouring), and on a Saturday, it was near dinner time. this place came up, and it featured high reviews. ok i said, let's go!

mind you, i had to hail and uber to go here as i'm visiting the area, and it was a bit of a way to walk. 

before i forget, first off, the service was so great. i didnt catch the name, but he was a nice chap, very patient with our party deciding what to get, which leads me to:

the menu is a bit confusing -- no explanations so it's hard to discern the difference between your chicken tikka chaat (which i had) or the lahori tikka. FYI make sure to mention gluten free if need be when ordering as they were able to accommodate my party (yay!) also there's like 10000 different types of lassis, which is both good and bad as it might've been a tad too many choices. 

(but the PLUS IS THAT THEY HAVE VEGAN ALMOND MILK LASSIS YAY )

OK so the chicken tikka chaat: first glance looks good? first bites ok? then it hits me: where's the chicken even???? oh it's mashed? ok (?) also it was super spicy. the thing that drops this down is that the cilantro chutney was a green that no cilantro is -- it looked like it was dyed :( and so was this other tamarind chutney that was dyed red :( why tho???

also, the lassi? glad i had an option as it's not always i find almond milk lassis, but as i drank more of the mango lassi it was way too sweet. :(

all in all, for this west coaster and from this region of the world, could be better.

What can I say about mood cafe that has not already been said?
1) Hassan is one of the friendliest and most welcoming person I have ever met. He creates a really unique concoction of chaat and knocks it out of the park everytime.
2) get the mango lassi
3) just get it
4) seriously.
5) It's veg and non veg friendly. Which is strange because as an Indian, this was the first time I ever had meat in my Chaat. it was absolutely awesome. 
6) If you are unfamiliar with Chaat, just get ready for an explosion of flavor and pure deliciousness of textures and tastes. Hassan does a great job at walking you through it and I seriously doubt you will ever regret coming here.

My boyfriend and I visited Mood Cafe for the first time today upon the recommendation of a friend, and we'll definitely be back. We are both vegan and it was nice to see that the lassi menu was clearly labeled that any of them can be made vegan. We asked the friendly owner which of the chaats could be made vegan and he said "any of them!" He asked if it was our first time having chaat (it was) and explained what is in it. We asked him for his recommendation and he made us one samosa chaat and one #3 (I forget what it was called). Both were delicious- an interesting mix of sweet, salty, savory and spicy flavors and crunchy and soft textures. We also had a mango lassi and a peach lassi. The peach one was good but the mango was better. We'll definitely be returning for more!

I was craving some Indian/Pakistani/halal food for dinner so I skimmed through Yelp and couldn't help but notice this place because it had 5 stars! So I obviously had to try it and yes, it was definitely a 5 star experience!

The owner, Hassan, was super friendly and helpful and took the time to explain what a lassi and chaat was because I told him it was my first time and I had never had them before. He said he'll take care of it and asked my boyfriend and I our meat preferences (they had a lot of choices, btw!). I asked for the chicken and my boyfriend went for the beef. I also wanted to try their lassi so he recommended the mango one, he even gave us another one because he was so certain that we were gonna love it! That way we didn't have to share! 

Both the chicken and the beef chaat were amazing! Definitely something new for my taste buds. It was very flavorful and savory, it basically had different tastes every bite I took. I personally liked the chicken better than the beef just because the chaat was so flavorful, and the chicken had less flavor than the beef so it cancels it out. 

I also ordered the veggie samosa which was also good but after trying to finish my chicken chaat (which I didn't finish their servings I would say is really good for the price) i couldn't eat any more of the samosa I felt like there were too many flavors going on in my mouth. 

But I will definitely be back mainly because of the outstanding service, and their mango lassi!

I have really tried not to post a bad review but I just can't take it anymore!

I'm not sure what's going on with the place, maybe it's the employees that have been working there but the chaats are no longer as tasty and don't have the same variety of ingredients they used to have. They are also much smaller than they used to be. I really hope this is not deliberate but an error on the employees part. I'll give the place one more shot but this time I'll ask Hassan to make it for me. If it's the same then they will loose a customer.

Huge selection. Everything is good. we had pani puri, lamb chat and rose Lassi. 

Customer service is good.

If you're like me, you have trouble deciding what flavor milk shake-lassi-shaved ice to order when you go to your local icee eatery. Fortunate for us, Hassan has solved the dilemma: you can mix and match flavors at the uber-delicious and refreshing Mood Cafe. 

Want to branch out from the thick, rich, mango lassi but can't decide whether to try mint or honey? Why not get both! I ordered a shaved ice and was tempted yet scared by the idea of rose or sandalwood, though mango and strawberry are options as well. What to do? Shaved ice suicide! All the flavors together, double-rainbow style with fresh fruit layered in! Being from the south, shaved ices are a summer staple, but this is the best shaved ice I have ever (and likely will ever) have. Usually, once it gets all melty I toss out the syrupy liquid. But in Mood Cafe's case, I look around for a straw! Yum!

There are also plenty of vegan options-Hassan said he can make a coconut milk lassi or milk shake. I'm not a vegan, but that sounds so darn good, I may have to try it...along with about a hundred other things.

Service definitely deserves 5 stars.

I give it 4 stars, overall, though, because I actually didn't think the food was that much, and for whatever reason my chaat had sweet flavors overpowering the savory flavors. It was still good, though.

UPDATE: Since Hassan has made various additions to the menu, I am compelled to write an update to the review I wrote earlier.

The new additions are the kabobs, meals and soups...perfect for the cooler weather. The meals are wholesome and like 'home-made meals', especially the daals. The Shami kabobs are excellent!!
Having a sweet tooth, the newly added sweets also caught my eye. I tried the ras malai and carrot halwa, and they are delicious!

In spite of all these additions, one thing is the same - Hassan's enthusiasm and love for what he does. The taste and quality of all his products is consistently good! Its already a regular haunt for me, but with the frequent, new and absolutely lip-smacking additions Hassan is always making, it is a fun trip everytime! Whenever I go there, I have this question - what new, yummy thing will Hassan have today? And I must say, I have never been disappointed!
------------------------
Coming from the land of chaat and lassis, I must say, I am impressed! I discovered it, right on its second day of existence, and rejoiced to find not just chaats and lassis, but awesome milkshakes, shaved ice and FRESH SQUEEZED juices. So far, I have been here about 5 times, getting something new each time. Usually, I am the kind who sticks to my favorites and is wary of venturing onto something new, but this place has so many tempting options, that you just have to try them. 
The chaats are quite authentic with all the chaat-imperative sauces and ingredients spot on. I especially love the aloo paapri chaat and the dhokla chaat. 
Hassan, the owner, is enthusiastic and is really proud of the products he serves. He especially prides himself on selling fresh juices, which true to the word and absolutely fresh, delicious and refreshing, with no preservatives or sugar, Hassan proudly states. He is generous and gives you samplers the juices ready - the latest addition to the list is grape juice, quite delicious. My favorites are the orange juice and apple juice, with the carrot juice and beet juice following at a close second place.

The lassis and the milkshakes are divine! My choice would be: the all-berry lassi and the saffron milk-shake (Hassan made me a special one, after I told him that I like cooling flavor of sandalwood too). 

Gotta go there!

I met Hassan the other day and he could not have been more welcoming and friendly! We tried his Lassi's and our jaws dropped in disbelief... They were incredible. The perfect mixture of smooth, creamy and cold. And not only were they delicious, they were gorgeous and marbleized.... it was almost too beautiful to drink! The mango Lassi was what I tried so far and I can't wait to go back and try all 60 flavors. We also tried the Chaat and I've never had anything like it. Hassan describes them as "Indian Nachos" and I couldn't have put it better myself. You MUST try Mood Cafe, you will not be disappointed.

-the food is clearly fresh and delicious
-the Lassi is great, try it out,

-the owner is genuinely the best service provider I've ever encountered at any price point

- it's absolutely worth a trip, it's clear why this place is so loved

Mood cafe was an interesting experience, since I had never had this style food before. The mango was delicious and the employee was nice. I also appreciate the opportunity to try this food.

It would be nice to have more people working there because ordering took unnecessarily long and once we got the food, a long line had formed right next to our table, making it unpleasant to eat. The obvious need for security was also unnerving (closed circuit tv prominently displayed).
Such good lassis. So many flavors so delicious/refreshing. I've gotten cardamom rose and rose pistachio and they were both so good.
I was looking for inexpensive quick food. So I yelped and now Im a fan. At first i was concerned because everything was premade and he had a microwave. But this place was AWESOME.

Mood cafe is a must go place!! I saw the reviews and wanted to try once, then found to be one of the best chaat places. Indian chaats modified with papdi,cut  fruits and chutneys. Dont expect to see typical chaat here, instead try out different flavourful new combinations. Also I was shocked to see 60 types of Lassi!! OMG just awesome. I had Samosa chaat, Almond pistachio lassi and my hubby had Panjabi chaat, original lassi. Everything was delicious, worth five stars. Owner is really courteous and talkative, it was almost closing time and still he took time to talk with us. I cant wait to visit this place again.
"Rose lassi is the best, don't pay unless you like" said the server Hasan (owner), indeed it was the best Rose lassi with rose petals in it

"Do you accept credit card?"
"I do, but the machine isn't working right now."
"Hmm.. I don't have any cash on me"
"Don't worry about it. You can pay for it the next time you come."
"Assuming there's a next time."
"We'll see about that. :)"

'nuf said! Hassan is legit. He also spent 10 minutes explaining what chaat was.


Small space. Clean. Not much indoor seating (10?). Organized menu. Chaat was deliciously spicy (per my request.)

If it were only more conveniently located...

Hassan is awesome and always hooks it up.  Cannot go wrong with the "just make me whatever you feel like" option. Check out this rave review from the Good Yummy Eats food blog: http://goodyummyeats.wordpress.com/2013/08/18/mood-cafe-ecstasy-guaranteed/

In all honesty, nothing that I say here will do anything except add to the truth we already know: this is one of the most fabulous eating establishments in all of Philadelphia. 

I came here with my parents and a couple of friends. None of us had the slightest idea about what to order. No problem. The lone man at the counter asked us what meat we preferred, the level of spice we were looking to try, and if there were any sauces we were opposed to. The answers to those three questions produced, for each of us, a magical and absolutely exquisite combination that stunned the group into happy silence. 

The lassi is also phenomenal. We each tried a different flavor--all amazing! Instead of tossing the leftovers, the man at the counter gave us all of the extras in smaller cups so we could sample them from each other. 

If you are anywhere near this place (as in, somewhere within the city limits of Philadelphia) you MUST try the food here. It will be a simple and unforgettable dining experience.

I can't speak highly enough of The Mood Cafe. The guy running the place gave us an outstanding background & description of each of the dishes, delighting those of us in the group who were unfamiliar with chaat.  His charm also worked magic on the food: it was mouthwatering; An impeccable explosion of sweet & savory.  We sampled a few dishes & shared it family style.  Each dish was unique and flavorful. I cherished every bite and look forward to the next time I'm in town. First stop: Mood Cafe, a delicious destination for locals & travelers alike.

The service is fantastic. The owner is incredibly friendly and more than willing to answer any questions you may have about the chaat and lassi. Some of the lassis use box fruit juice, but that doesn't make it any less delicious. Rose in particular was really good.

After hearing so many great things about this place, I hate to say that I wasn't really fond of their chaats. I don't think I will come back here again but because of the owners passion and friendless, I am going to give this a 4 star. The owner is extremely helpful in helping you decide what chaat is and what exactly the ingredients/toppings are. As an Indian, I think this place is meant for non-Indians who don't know what real Indian food is suppose to taste like.
Laasis are average. 
Overall, I'm glad I tried it. 
PS: the owner claims that if you don't like the chaat, you won't have to pay for it. But in my opinion, if you get a whole container of chaat, finish eating it and then say you don't like it, I think that's just plain rude and cheap of you to not pay for the food (whether you liked it or not).

Let me say that making the discovery of this absolute gem in West Philly was one of the highlights of my stop in Philly on tour. Because I was only in town for the night and had a show to play, I needed to find something delicious that was also fast and inexpensive. 

The gentlemen at Mood make it a point to live up to the hype of their reviews and boy, do they. If I lived in West Philly, this would be a constant haunt for me. 

The food here is simple - Chat and Lassi. It's true that you simply can't go wrong. Close your eyes and pick a dish. If you live here, try them all.

Hassan bhai is among my favorite Pakistanis now. 

Good chat. Excellent lassis. 

Hassan bhai ke baathein aur imaandaari se bani behthereen mahol.

This was the first time I tried chaat, and I absolutely loved it.  It's got many different textures and flavors that really work well together and the owner was really helpful in navigating me through their menu.  I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a tasty refreshing bite.

Thought we would check out Craig Leban's newest review and it didn't disappoint! Being Indian I am the pickiest of critiques but I do have to say the chaat was on point. And like the previous reviews mentioned, the owner Hassan is super friendly and there to make sure that you enjoy your order. If you don't then he will make you something else until you find something that you do enjoy. The bursting tip box was our clue to the service and food rendered here.

The lassis were wonderful, and with the extensive flavors where one can be lost, Hassan will point you in the right direction. Same with the chaats. We will be back to venture into new territory with both the lassis and the chaats. 

We had an extensive conversation with Hassan and left with the feeling that he pours his passion of cooking into his food, making masalas from scratch (roasting seeds and grinding them himself) instead of buying premade spices because it provides a much higher/fresher quality product. With so much care in his work, how can the end product disappoint?

So.Good. Chaat has like fifty ingredients in it. Jk. Maybe 15? I got the samosa chaat and my sister got one of the chicken ones. Both were delicious. The owner was so nice, explaining to us what chaat was and told us that if we didn't like it we would get our money back. After we were done eating he came outside and gave us a complimentary rice pudding to try. 

Also got one mango and one kiwi lassi. 

Stuffed and happy.

Good food, a bit overrated. The chat isn't as authentic as the owner makes it out to be, it's fusion chat. Reasonable, but some of the combinations don't quite work for me. That said, top notch ingredients and service. One star off, mainy because of the actual menu and execution.

This place is great the smoothies (that aren't called smoothies) are really good the selection of flavors is ridiculous!

One thing I didn't like is my friend wanted to try the lamb with the chicken but he for some reason couldn't mix the two.

other than that he is very helpful you can add or keep or remove other items like chick peas, or dates (which I don't love)

I went twice so far and will be back, great food!

My gf and I actually didn't really care for the food that much. It's different: the idea is for each bite to have a different flavor.

However, I'm giving 4 stars to this place because the owner insisted that we not pay until after we ate, and said that he wouldn't charge us if we didn't like our food. That is just awesome.

There are a lot of different lassi flavors; my gf and I got to separate flavors. However, both pretty much tasted like mango lassi to us. Ah well.

This place was the first time I ever had Chaat.  The owner and workers are very friendly and take the time to introduce you to what they offer which is different than anything else you'll find in Philly.  Definitely one of my favorite places to eat.  Thanks for the treat mood cafe!
this place is mad legit. Authentic chaat that is tastefully done. The owner is a great guy.
Mood Cafe, is a great place for a heathy snack also a awesome heathy meal at a great price!

Really really great customer service. Never had a chaat before so he took the time to explain what it is and what he puts into the different ones on the menu. There was a humongous variety of chaats and types of lassi to choose from, and they all sounded delicious! He was very generous with how much food he gave and made the experience very pleasant.
The owner is amazing! Spent five minutes explaining what chaat was. Also said the only charge for food which is completely delicious. food that tastes only 'ok' is free.

Mood cafe is a quaint corner shop where the owner asks you what you are in the mood for. He explains the concept of his restaurant and what goes in his chaats. He is very friendly and aims to please. 

I went with a few people so we got a variety of lassi, which included: mango, honeydew, guava, peach, and watermelon. 

We also got two lamb and chicken chaats, which were spicy and mild. This meal is packed FULL of flavor. I had it in the winter, but I can also imagine myself having it during the hot summers because it's SUPER refreshing. It has so much flavor and is very visually appealing from the vibrant colors of the dish. 

The best lassi is the rose flavor. I must have had at least 10 different flavors and the rose was, by far, the best tasting one. The mango lassi wasn't the best I've ever had, as it was just good. 

Come give this place a try to have an awesome experience of small business owner who really cares about his food and makes sure his customers are well taken care of. 

There's some parking across the street.

After seeing so many 5 star reviews I was a little skeptical, and thought there must be some star inflation going on here. Nope - not a bit. This was one of the best meals I've had all year. The incredibly gracious & friendly service I received made the meal even more memorable. I had no idea what Chaat was, but the owner (Hassan I assume) gave me a brief tutorial and outlined my options. I couldn't believe that all of the ingredients he listed were going into my dish! I asked for chicken, and he created layers of salad, spices, mango, dates, sauces, cheese, and tasty crunchy bits. The medium spice level was perfect - and allowed me to enjoy all of the flavors. 

You can't go here without ordering a lassi as well. They are made fresh to order, and he has a ridiculous variety of flavors. I picked Rose, as it was my first visit and I'd never tried that before. My lassi was made of actual rose petals & was perfectly milky and sweet.

After watching Hassan create my meal, I was pretty confident I was going to love it. But he insisted that I try it out before paying, and he mentioned a couple of times that he wouldn't ask me to pay for anything I didn't like. Ha! I doubt anybody has ever taken him up on that offer. 

It's a good thing I don't live near this place or else I'd probably be there all the time. I can't wait to go back and explore the menu!

Now this place is really different, but the owner is so nice and can sell you anything. The smoothie menu is unique but definitely worth a try. The cuisine is like none other than I heard before, but don't miss out on trying something new. I was scared at first, but all the flavors he put together where natural, simple and quite tasty. I will giving this place a second try most definitely in the future!

Chaat, their signature dish, is like nothing you have ever tasted before.  Others here have described it aptly.  I will just add my own experience.  It is a combination of tastes and textures that are absolutely incredible.  To steal an inane but appropriate phrase, chaat is a party in your mouth.  Open your mind and try it.  The owner was so confident that he said he would not charge me if I didn't like it or just thought it was ok.  I was happy to give him money.  Then for dessert he gave me some sweet homemade cheese, a little like ricotta but sweeter.

Okay, first, I  have to say that Secret V. is going to have to update his/her review-- Mood Cafe does serve Vegan Lassis and now has a sign in the window to advertise them! :-) 

Hassan, the owner, is awesome. Friendly, generous, and is really proud of his product. As he should be -- the lassis are amazing. I had the strawberry and mango lassis, and they were the perfect flavor and texture. He has a ton of other flavors, too -- mint, honey, blueberry, etc.-- so I can already see that I'm going to spend most of my summer trying them all. 

Add to that the juice-- seriously, I might have found a new addiction with the carrot juice. I don't even eat carrots in their natural state-- but the juice?! So pure, so sweet, so cold and refreshing. I had one last night and I tried to go by to get one again this morning (but it wasn't open yet)!

They also serve beet juice, apple juice, and others-- ALL FRESH-SQUEEZED! And delicious! Seriously, Mood Cafe makes an all-liquid diet seem like a good idea. I also ate a couple of samosas that Hassan dressed for me with peas and other flavors - the spices were so yummy and the toppings made it SO good. The perfect complement to the liquid ambrosia I had been consuming earlier. 

I have no doubt I'm going to be making my way to Mood Cafe many times this summer. I'm only afraid that with stuff this tasty, the place may get TOO popular!

The concept of the food here is great! You take the freshness and the variety of indian chaat, give it a slightly modern twist with the sauces used, throw some protein in there and you get a very exciting mix of flavors and textures. I am sure a lot of people have tried doing something of this sort but this particular combination clicks. 

We got the chicken tikka chaat and a coconut lassi. The crunch and the sweet are mildly different from a convention chaat preparation. The portions are very big as opposed to small bite sized plates usually. The lassi is more of a smoothie that a regular lassi and there are tons of flavors to choose from. I'm a bit of a purist when it comes to lassi so i was scared to stray away too far from convention. 

I would definitely go back to try a few more of their combinations, hopefully run into "The Hassan" that everyone talks about

PS. I generally never forget to take pictures of the food, this time the excitement got the better of me

Went here once so far with a sometimes picky relative who highly recommended it, so that itself was a good endorsement! It was clean and bright, and empty of customers when the 4 of us arrived. Since I had never been, I asked a few questions and the gentleman behind the counter, a young dude with thick-brimmed glasses, was funny, helpful, patient and happy to assist, providing answers and recommending selections. After we placed our orders we noticed the place filling up with customers, some appeared to be regulars and some new like us, and he took great care of everyone while filling orders too. We each got different chat and lassis to go, and everything was so freakin good. Fresh, crunchy, salty, spicy, sweet, refreshing. You should go! Try the Crazy chat and chocolate peanut butter banana lassi - they'll even make it vegan.

Wow, this has to be the best bang for your buck in Philly.  Chicken chaat has so much flavor, so much texture; salty, sweet, savory, tangy, crunchy, and so fresh.  Rose lassi and rice pudding were fantastic. Will definitely be back.

This review is solely for the lassis and the service...

I took my boyfriend here to experience his first lassi, raving about how delicious they are and how since childhood they have been my favorite part of the Indian dining experience.

When we popped by the one trained employee there was training a newbie who seemed to be on their very first day.  While I am usually very patient in these kinds of situations, I was pretty frustrated that they chose to train someone on how to make a lassi on a Saturday evening.

When we finally got our peach lassi it was very milky, icy, bland, and not at all peachy.  It was nothing like the tangy, thick yogurt-drink I imagined it to be.  Maybe I just don't like their style, but this lassi was nothing to write home about and we actually ended up giving it to our cats...

I'll definitely be back to give them another try though... the chaats look great and I'm hoping this is not their norm.

I heard so many good things about Mood Cafe that I had to go see it for myself. I was not disappointed! I love a good Punjabi and it was better than I had expected. When it was handed to me it was not what I'm used to seeing a Punjabi look like. It was colorful and flavorful! It was a mix between crunchy and soft, spicy and sweet. And I paired it off with a Mango Lassi which was also very good but I would say that they needed to add a little more mango and less yogurt. I will definitely be going back to try all their other dishes and lassi's.

Mood Cafe is a great place to stop for a refreshing lassi blended with fresh fruit. Pick from selection of fresh fruit including pineapple, mango, blueberry, peach, etc. You can also include fresh mint (straight from a mini-garden on the sidewalk) for a tangy twist. Mix and match if you want! Note that these lassis are not the usual thick yogurty versions but are more ice-y. If you are lactose-intolerant, there are non-dairy versions too. 

The cafe also serves a variety of chaat, both vegetarian and non-vegetarian. If you have never tried chaat, I would highly recommend tasting the flavor explosion of potato pieces, fried wonton-like crisps, chickpeas, onions, etc covered tangy-spicy-sweet sauces, yogurt, and other spices. The owner will make you a chaat based on your "mood" and if it doesn't quite fit your fancy, he is willing to make you another one.

There is limited seating at Mood Cafe - only a counter of about 5 seats and additional outdoor seating. But most people order take-out (samosas to go!) so there is usually an open spot to grab.

My husband found the Mood Cafe on Yelp, and we are so glad he did!! We both had the Chicken Tikka, and we didn't talk at all while enjoying our lunch. The Pomegranate Lassi was delicious!! My husband had the Mango Lassi and he loved it! Thanks so much for a great lunch!
The owner is so friendly, and giving he makes you feel welcomed. You can really taste the love in his cooking, highly recommend!
Amazing. Delicious. Kind owner. Had the beef chaat medium spice. Really good. The fruit was so fresh! Bottled water was on the house. The place is just perfect and the owner is so friendly!

It's always comfy and cozy to stop by Mood. 
So many flavours of lassis it's mind-boggling.
My current 3 favourites are:
Rose/Cardamon....
Cucumber/Black Seed....
Honey Ginger

They also have great choices of chaat!

We go there at least once a week. If we lived closer, we'd pretty much live there.

While this place is pretty good, I think 'Desi Chaat House' close by actually has better chaat. Where better means that the flavors and textures are better balanced and more carefully chosen, and the quality of the ingredients also seems superior. The Mood Cafe chaats seemed to all taste pretty much the same.

Of course Hassan is quite a performer, while DCH has much quieter service - I'm guessing that's why this place gets so much more attention.

My experience is based on just one visit to each place, so YMMV.

After a year and a half of consistently going to Mood, I realized I should add my five-star review to the plethora of them that already exist. Mood isn't the best food I've ever had, and I don't think it's trying to be. But damn is the owner good at doing the few things he does. 

Also, when I went vegan, it was one of first things I knew I could have; both the chaats and lassis can be made vegan. The vegan pomegranate lassi is my new favorite, whereas the fig/rose combo lassi was my old non-vegan fave. I've never had an issue with the food, though I never have touched the meat and can't review that, and I've never had an issue with the lassis except for not liking all the flavors. That just comes down to personal preference, though, as I know others who love the flavors I am not a fan of, and vice versa.

(By the way, do try to branch out further than the mango lassi! IMO many of the others are WAY better, and you can get mango lassi in so many other places.)

My friends and I try to limit ourselves, but I think on average I have Mood about once a week. (In my defense, it's across from the laundromat and it's my treat for doing laundry.) Hassan has impressed me and my friends as I bring more and more of them to try his food. The most recent time I was there, Hassan accidentally did not make a vegan chaat for me (though I always do ask), but after I asked if there was yoghurt on my chaat he realized his mistake and quickly and apologetically made me the new chaat AND gave me the old one with the yogurt on it to "share with my friends," which I happily did. What nice customer service. :)

My friend and I went to this restaurant for the first time two weeks ago. The lassi...is just absolutely delicious! We both got the honeydew lassi. The food was good. It was an awesome experience Hassan, the owner, displayed great friendliness and hospitality. The rice pudding was pretty good, too.

Wow! This place is amazing! The owner, Hassan, is the sweetest guy! If you've never tried chaats before, he tells you to tell him what meat or if you want no meat and how spicy you'd like it then he makes you the best thing you've ever had. As other reviewers have also said, he tells you if you've ever had a better chaat or you simply don't like your chaat, it is on the house. The Lassis are equally as amazing although, the lassi and chaat were too much for me to finish. I recommend to anyone even if you have to go out of your way to get there. If I lived in the area, I'd be there everyday! Such a great experience!

I would highly recommend this place! The food and drinks were great. And the owner is awesome!! It was my first time trying the Lassis, and I was torn between two flavors so he gave me a sample of one of the flavors (along with the one I ordered) which turned out to almost be a whole one. Go go go

Not that this place needs another 5 star review, but I've just got to give it one. Today was my first time eating chaat, but I love similar foods, and have wanted to try this restaurant for a while. The owner (I think) made it a memorable experience for both me and my fiancé. It was a flavor explosion that was perfectly spicy (we like spicy). The lassis were awesome, although I felt a little guilty after eating mine; it was as decadent as any dessert...delicious. I look forward to returning. The seating area is very, very small, but we were lucky enough to snag a table. The owner even let everyone in the restaurant try something just because a kid that was there asked what it was. He told us we didn't have to pay unless we loved everything, and he would change anything we wanted. This is how a restaurant should be run, and this kind of customer service is why this place consistently gets 5 stars. They make you feel welcome and appreciated, like they truly want you to enjoy their creations. Other restaurants in Philly should take notice. We will definitely be back, and soon.

Walked in without much knowledge of chaat. First time and Hassan(owner) couldn't have been more helpful and understanding. He was enthusiastic to go over the menu options with us. Also he was able to make my laasi and chaat dairy free. The food was fantastic and priced fairly. We got into a conversation with him about health and beauty. This sparked a passionate demonstration from him including samples of various recipes he had for a variety of ailments. From dry skin to libido...Hassan has a formula.  Girlfriend had a lot of fun trying his different skin care tips. I wish there were more businesses like such in Denver!

How I have lived less than five minutes from here and never tried it before is beyond me... and was a huge mistake. The food is AMAZING. I love Indian food but had never had chaat before and I have been leery. I'm one of those people that doesn't always love all my food mixed together. However, this proved me wrong. The food was really flavorful and the guy who made my food was really helpful about recommending what to get, how spicy I would like it, what kind of lassi to pair it with AND even made the whole thing (lassi included) vegan for me!

Seriously, in a neighborhood of good food this place is a standout. 

Go here, eat amazing food, drink a delicious lassi, and experience friendly and helpful customer service.

I finally decided to go check out this new place across the street. I ordered chicken chaat and it was SO good. Different flavors mixed in harmony. Then I decided to get some lassi. I asked Mr. Hassan, who's very generous and welcoming, for suggestion and he suggested to mix banana and dates. It was AWESOME! Very tasteful and refreshing. I'm planning to try all other flavors soon. I also want to try the vegetarian chaat. Will keep you posted about the other lassi flavors and the vegetarian chaat.

Go Mood Cafe!

The service was incredible! I asked Siri for figs and she lead me here. It's a beautiful day so I decided to walk down and it was definitely worth it! 

I had the fig lassi and samosa chaat with figs! First time having it all and it is so delicious! I can't wait to come back

The Mango lassi was the creamiest most delicious "smoothie" I've ever had! The samosa chaat was an amazing combination of so many delicious, high quality & fresh ingredients & spices. I'm still amazed at how this "orgi" of a dish tasted so perfect...the chaat was bursting with so many different flavors- sweet, spicy, salty-but somehow it all complimented each other perfectly and created this amazing dish I had never had anything comparable to before. Will definitely be back to try more chaats & lassi's!!

From the people who brought you Desi Village and Desi Chaat House comes Mood Cafe, a nice little addition to Baltimore Ave.

A friend and I stopped in a couple of weeks after opening in search of something suitable for obscenely hot weather - meaning not too heavy and a short walk away. I also remembered seeing that they served lassi and milkshakes, so off we went!

My friend comes from a sad, sad place where she can get Indian food but not chaat. I feel bad for her. So she was a little overwhelmed and watched carefully as the guy at the counter explained everything he was going to do to my papri chaat. That was no simple task, since this chaat was loaded up like you would not believe. I can't even begin to list all the things that went into it, just layer after layer of all good things. Maybe a little heavy-handed on the sauce so it got soupy toward the end, but every bite brought something new.

In fact, it was loaded up enough that we considered sharing. We were talked into getting a couple of samosas to go with, which was very kindly turned into samosa chaat just to make our tastebuds happier. And, seeing that my friend was unused to chaat, the owner told her not to pay until after she'd eaten. Very nice of him. She loved it, though!

Even though were were stuffed from our chaat orgy, dessert was needed. Namely, something cold! My friend was intrigued by the sandlewood shaved ice (something I will be trying someday) but sadly the ice machine had not been delivered yet! We both ended up with saffron milkshakes, a great choice. The shakes are made thin, which means you can suck them down on a summer day without feeling like you'll explode. The saffron ice cream is heavy on the pistachio, but tasty and something you're not going to find everywhere.

Overall, Mood Cafe was a great experience. It's obvious that the owner is really going out of his way to bring in business and distinguish this location from Desi's other spots. He's doing a great job, and I'm glad to help by raving about the food and service! Another trip or two that good and I'll bump them up to 5 stars for sure!

Love the place and the owner. I've never seen so many combinations of lassi.

Not much to add given how much has already been said.

Five stars all around! Had the fig lassie and samosa chaat. Amazing meal for under ten bucks. The owner is incredibly nice and only accepts payment if you are satisfied. The fig lassie was amazing and the samosa chat was an explosion of flavor. Every forkful tasted different. Will definitely come back. Thank you Mood Cafe!

Chaat is basically a taste-free-for-all. Do you want a sort of South Asian spicy/sweet/savory/tangy explosion in your mouth? If you do, then you should check this place out. It wasn't what I was looking for on a cold, Sunday afternoon but it was super delightful. I was glad to have found it. You know how sometimes you eat something and it's so healthful that you feel your cells rejoicing? That's this place.

Also, everyone is right about Hassan. He is so helpful and so happy to introduce you to Chaat. I'd go back just for him. Also they can make their lassis vegan? Whaaaaat!
Mood Cafe is a small gem in West Philly. There are about 60 flavors of lassi. I got the strawberry lassi and loved it!

I honestly didn't know what to get and I was by myself. Asked the man working which of the chicken dishes he would suggest and he immediately said "chicken tikka." Straight faced, no hesitation. He did not steer me wrong! I like my food spicy but not crying spicy and this is it! I don't even fully know what is in this besides chicken and chickpeas but it's delicious!!

The owner at Mood Cafe is wonderful and is a super sweet guy and a great conversation.  I haven't had a chance to eat any of the food yet but the lassi's are AMAZING.  I highly recommend the Pina Colada lassi!  It's amazing and definitely worth skipping your diet for!

Hassan is the wonderful owner of Mood Cafe and he always puts together delicious concoctions made of fried crunchy things and fresh fruit and veggies. They even have meat chaats if you're feeling a little adventurous. They have like 19413 flavors of lassis and every one that I've tried has been delicious. I recommend this place to all of my friends and it is deserving of every 5 star review here. The line can get a little crazy during lunch, so I would recommend going during off hours to save time and effort.

This is one of the best places in the area!  You will  never leave disappointed.  Hassan, the owner, is so genuine and friendly.  He wants you to be very happy with your experience.  My favorite item on the menu is Chatt.  It is a superbly delicious healthy snack bursting with fresh flavors.  It can be made vegetarian or with chicken of lamb.  All the food is good and very affordable prices.  You really have to give Mood a try.  Your  life isn't complete until  you've tried Chaat.  (The Lassies are wonderful too.)

So happy to visit this place again after missing it for a few years! The owner is passing on his techniques to some younger staff who do a good job of maintaining the "magic show" that goes into making chaat this way.

This chat place offers very creative selection of charts that I never had before and neither do I think I will ever get to experience outside philly.
There food collides two course of meal, appetizer and entree in one and does it exceptionally well.
I have taken several friends of mine and everyone loves this place. I frequent this place and I will sum up my chat experience as- party in my mouth and everyone is invited.
People are very courteous and helpful. Got to try fig lassi and dates lassi.
Happy eating everybody

I would give Mood Cafe 6 stars if I could. I would give Mood Cafe more stars than I have ever given any place else. This place... just..WOW. I can't explain. I was skeptical upon hearing my boyfriend rave about this place, saying it was the best food he had ever eaten. When I came to Philly, we went here, and first of all, Hassan is the nicest person ever. Such a great guy. We ordered:
- 2 chicken chaat
- 2 lassis (peaches and cream, persimmon and honey (which isn't on the menu, Hassan is just a baus))

Let me just say... This food seriously made me reevaluate the definition of great food. This is it. This is the exact definition of perfection. Every bite was a different burst of flavor. I cannot recommend this place highly enough. GO if you haven't yet!

Moving away from Philly has been devastating because I get uncontrollable cravings for this place and its Chicken Salad Chaat. I've been here countless times since it opened up in 2011, and tried a variety of the lassi flavor combinations. Combining chaat with salad is sheer genius and that credit goes to the owner Hasan who is also behind Desi Chaat House. Seriously, the idea should be patented by him, as it's the most unique way to make South Asian street food trendy, hip, healthy, and accessible to people. The chaat serves as the crunch, and the raitas and chutneys as dressing for the salad, with other delicious mix-ins. The lassi's are pretty great too. Mood Cafe uses fresh fruit that is frozen so that any flavor smoothie can be enjoyed in any season. My personal favorites are the guava lassi and the pomegranate lassi. I love going back to this place every time I visit philly. 

If only there were more places like this in the Midwest too.

Like many of the reviewers, I ventured to this place because of the reviews. Plus it's listed as the number one Yelp food place in Philadelphia--so of course I had to go. I give it five stars for the food and service. The mango lassi was decent--I typically expect something a little thicker though, but I wasn't disappointed. The samosa chaat was AMAZING. 

The atmosphere is not really what I was expecting. I didn't come when it was crowded, fortunately, but it looks like a place where one should order and takeout (sit outside or take-home). I took the food home to eat, which was perfect. I wouldn't really eat in, but I know some people do. 

Summary: five stars for delicious food and good service. Potential downside is the space, but I don't think it mattered that much. 

P.S. The server gave my mom a free mango lassi! He seems really awesome.

Never realized that this place existed until I got on Yelp to find a place for a meetup for a friend in the city, but man is this place as good as it gets! Come here for the chaats ... they are beyond delicious. Love how the owner asks for your preferences before making it (attentive much?). In general, the chaats are blended together wonderfully. Never had I had so many flavors going through my mouth at once ... savory of the carbs, tangy of the fruit/mango, sweet of some Pakistani ethnic fruit, etc. etc. In short, it resulted in one very happy mouth at the end of the day.
You can't go wrong with the lassis either, though I would go for the mango one. Light on sugar and definitely light on the conscience vs. frozen yogurt or ice cream (in terms of calories).
However, I think the one thing that really impressed me was the customer service ... he won't let me pay him unless I found the food satisfying. Not only that ... he also ended up giving us two desserts (rice pudding and carrot something) for free and refused to let us pay for them. Both of the desserts were delicious ... rice pudding was perfect as the rice helped to moderate the sugar content of the dessert and as for the other, I found the carrot dessert excessively sweet even for a sweet tooth like me. Nonetheless, I will definitely return down the line.

Last night I went to Mood Cafe for the first time, and it will now be one of my go-to spots. The concept is simple yet brilliant. 

The Lassi was incredible. It was like a smoothie, but more refreshing. The Chaat was a medley of delicious flavors and textures that blended very well.

The customer service was as good as the food and drink, Hassan is obviously passionate about his food and his restaurant. He was very friendly and asked about our preferences to make the Chaat and Lassi to our liking.

Overall a fantastic experience.

FIG LASSI!!!!

I almost wish that I never tried the lassi here....almost.  I am now addicted and I can't stomach that thick gross stuff served pretty much everywhere else.  I am totally in love with the lassi here.   It is light and fresh tasting, and not too sweet.  And the flavors they use are very fresh - no artificial flavoring here.  Amazing.  What can be said about the owner that hasn't already been said before, below?  He is the messiah of lassi and chaat, spreading the word like gospel.  His claims live up to the reality of the taste.  

Do yourself a favor and go get some.  You owe it to yourself to see how amazing lassi can taste.  But beware.  Even if you live far away, like me, you will find yourself craving this drink on a daily basis.

Deserving of all 5 star reviews. When I moved to West Philly, my friend brought me here because he'd been wanting to go. I was so happy he did because with an uninteresting and undescriptive name like Mood Cafe, I'm not certain I would have come in anytime soon.

The service is fast and friendly and the food is a gigantic and pleasant surprise. Bountiful flavors, meshing and contrasting textures, color, and novelty. No one's heard about chaat and it's unfortunate because it's so tasty. I love to introduce this place to others because they deserve the attention.
Excellent chaat....owner welcomed us with utmost respect...lot of options... I am the fan of the lassi...

My boyfriend and I decided to try Mood Cafe after all the excellent Yelp reviews.   Neither of us had chaat before and weren't familiar.  The man (the owner, perhaps? ) running it explained it well and fixed us something tailored to our liking.  We both enjoyed our meals.  It was very fresh and the chicken was amazing.  My boyfriend tried the mango lassi and enjoyed it so much he got 1 to go.  The customer service here is what customer service is all about!  A rare gem any place!

This is my go to for fast food dinner. Not the healthiest, but the service is always really nice and the lassi flavors are great. 

I usually get the rose lassi which is fragrant and foamy. Mango lassi is good too. There are usually small ice crystals which make the texture actually really good. Plus anything leftover from the blender that they can't fit into the large cup, they put in a small cup to give to you also. It's those little things that make you feel like a business really cares about the customer's experience. 

Tbh this is the only place that I've gotten chaat so I don't have much to compare to, but the owner will make you feel super comfortable about ordering. I like the chicken tikka.
I've tried only 2 of the chaats- Bhel puri and Delhi chaat I think- they tasted similar but were both great. A burst of flavors and crunch -sweet, spicy, tangy. Will definitely be back.
Excellant Lassi's. Lots of flavors. Awesome chaats.

We've eaten here six times. The chaat is always good, the lassis are sweet and pair well with the chaat and the desserts are good too (try the rice pudding). People from out of town who visit and eat with us here love it. The best part? The owners. These guys really take care of every guest-- even taking the time to explain the history of chaat to new customers. We even met a guy here once who flew from Pakistan to Newark for a wedding and his first stop before the wedding? Mood cafe-- he had heard about the place (in Pakistan) and was told not to miss it. Crazy.

Went to the Mood Cafe today since I wanted to try something new and I have to say that I'm very happy and satisfied with my decision!  The chicken chaat and the mango lassi were delicious!  I never expected the chaat to be so full of flavor! It was sweet, savory, and a bit spicy. The mango lassi was not too sweet and really good with the chaat. Can't wait to go back and try some more, especially the lassi.

Mood Cafe is a lassie and chat based cafe, it's a unique place to chill with friends. In the summer the outdoor seating is great, and fits perfect with the refreshing lassies. Unfortunately the indoor seating is subpar.

As far as the food, I've never been disappointed. With all the options, selections, and combinations, along with the fact that you get a little extra lasssie to share with your friends, you can't go wrong with mood cafe! I recommend a rose-honey lassie. There are little sweet chewy pieces at the bottom, and the rose flavor works amazing with yogurt! 

I would like to visit in the colder months, but I doubt I will be as inclined to go with the indoor seating. If they moved the freezer (space is tight), acquired comfortable/fancy chairs, and put on some fitting music, I might change my mind!

Went here for the first time yesterday with my friend, and I must say I felt in love! Don't be fooled by the size of the place. It may look a bit small and old, but the menu is wonderful. They have about 100 types of lassi (not just mango lassi), ranging from fruit flavor, veggie to peanut butter. We got a mango - papaya lassi, a rose lassi and a chicken chatt. It's hard to say which one was best, because they all tasted wonderful. extremely aromatic and not too sweet (Yesss!) 

The owner was really friendly and nice to us. We got overwhelmed by the menu, so we stood there 15mins just to study it. Lol and he just chatted to us the whole time and making great great suggestions! I haven't met such a friendly, sweet and nice owner in a very very long time. And you can tell he's sincerely nice to you. And other customers there were very sweet as well. 

I can't make enough recommdation about this place! Great food, good price and more than wonderful service. It was my first time there, but won't be the last.

This is in the top of Yelp Philadelphia cheap eats? No way. Yelp too often rewards uniqueness over true quality and value. 

We shared the House Chaat. What a disaster. They basically throw 20 different food items, all with various non-compatible flavors and textures, and a bit of yogurt item a plastic container. I had no idea what was going on in my mouth and I didn't like it. I wanted to think this was a dessert, but then I'd get a chick pea. When four hungry guys all decline to finish a meal, you can be pretty sure there is a problem.

This place is not cheap or particularly good. Skip it. Go to Fu Wah around the corner and treat yourself to some Bahn mi. Come on Yelpers, five stars? Really?

they need more avocados!!!!!!

cmon we live in 2017


please add avocados!!!

add non dairy butter

rip milk

I've been here a few times in the past, and I have to say, Mood Cafe definitely lives up to its expectations every time. Hassan is as friendly as all the other reviewers say, really makes you feel welcome, and makes you want to return again and again.

The menu might look a little confusing at first, but Hassan breaks it down and customizes each customers' order according to taste. If you get a lassi, you'll often get a little cup that contains the rest of the lassi if it doesn't fit in the cup. The chaat is delicious, although I think a big part of this place is the experience and being able to interact with a restaurant owner in such a consistently positive way. 

Would recommend, definitely revisiting this place when I'm in the area, if only to grab a quick lassi.

This place had some amazing chaats and lassis. We got bhel Puri, garlic and ginger chicken chaat, chicken green chili chaat, rose lassi and Pina colada lassi. The chaats were delicious and the spice level can be customized to your preference. The rose lassi was really good.. it's made out of fresh roses. The owner is super friendly and the service is good. Would definitely recommend!

I've never written a review of anything before... but I love the Mood Cafe experience so much that I'll Yelp this one.

(a) I had my first chaat experience at Mood Cafe, so the combination of sweet and savory and tangy was surprising at first, but absolutely delicious about 3 bites in -- to the point where I've started craving it throughout the week, but I must go unsatiated because I live too far from Mood Cafe to just wander in whenever I want to.

(b) The owner, Hassan, is so, so awesome. Incredibly affable, really cares that you thoroughly enjoy your meal (he guarantees that you will, or you don't have to pay), and tends to throw in extra treats for free -- a lassi my first time, an ice cream sundae the second. A couple of my roommates made the trip to Mood Cafe on my recommendation, and they got free chai.

Go for the chaat, for the honey lassi, and to befriend Hassan!

This is one of my favorite places in philly. Since moving away I find myself wishing I could come back and get a samosa chaat and a lassi. The owner makes every experience so great because he is so friendly. I felt so comfortable coming with my baby and now with my toddler. Whenever I come back to philly I make it a point to visit.

Service was indeed very nice and helpful (it was my first time having chaats). Food was only ok, though. Too many ingredients, just couldn't exactly understand what I was tasting with each bite. I guess it's worth trying something new, but I'm not sure I'm coming back.
This place is the best. Hassan takes care to explain what chaat is and put every new customer at ease. And the food is delicious!

Mood Cafe is definitely one of the hidden gems of West Philly! I had heard a lot of positive things about it before I actually got to go and it definitely lived up to my expectations. My friends and I went for their lassis and we each ordered a different flavor. I ordered the blueberry lassi and my friends got a rose lassi and a chocolate raspberry lassi. 

The blueberry lassi was light and delicious. I asked for it with less sugar (I'm not too big of a fan of sweets) and the owner was happy to accommodate! I tried a sip of the rose lassi and it was delicious as well. It was sweet but had a touch of fennel to it. I didn't try the chocolate raspberry but my friend was extremely happy with it. 

Overall, I would highly recommend Mood Cafe for their lassis, which are very reasonably priced and are huge portions! The manager/owner was also extremely friendly and was willing to answer any of our questions and accommodate any modifications (like my request for less sugar).
